Identify optimal cell count range based on power thresholds (C++)

identify_cell_range_cpp.Rd

Determines minimum and maximum cell counts for power analysis using binary search. Uses a cross-search strategy to guarantee logical ordering (min_cells <= max_cells): finds min_cells with best-case reads and max_cells with worst-case reads.

Usage

identify_cell_range_cpp(
  min_reads_per_cell,
  max_reads_per_cell,
  fc_expression_df,
  UMI_per_cell,
  variation,
  MOI = 10,
  num_targets = 100L,
  gRNAs_per_target = 4L,
  non_targeting_gRNAs = 10L,
  control_group = "complement",
  multiple_testing_alpha = 0.05,
  side = "left",
  prop_non_null = 0.1,
  min_power_threshold = 0.01,
  max_power_threshold = 0.8,
  cell_lower_bound = 100,
  cell_upper_bound = 1e+07
)

Arguments

min_reads_per_cell

Numeric. Minimum reads per cell from library size range

max_reads_per_cell

Numeric. Maximum reads per cell from library size range

fc_expression_df

DataFrame with fold change and expression info

UMI_per_cell

Numeric. Maximum UMI per cell parameter from S-M curve

variation

Numeric. Variation parameter from S-M curve

MOI

Numeric. Multiplicity of infection (default 10)

num_targets

Integer. Number of targets (default 100)

gRNAs_per_target

Integer. gRNAs per target (default 4)

non_targeting_gRNAs

Integer. Non-targeting gRNAs (default 10)

control_group

String. Control group type ("complement" or "nt_cells", default "complement")

multiple_testing_alpha

Numeric. FDR target level (default 0.05)

side

String. Test sidedness ("left", "right", "both", default "left")

prop_non_null

Numeric. Proportion of non-null hypotheses (default 0.1)

min_power_threshold

Numeric. Minimum power threshold for min cells (default 0.01)

max_power_threshold

Numeric. Target power threshold for max cells (default 0.8)

cell_lower_bound

Numeric. Lower bound for total cell search (default 100)

cell_upper_bound

Numeric. Upper bound for total cell search (default 1e7)

Value

List with min_cells, max_cells, and achieved power values

Details

This function performs two binary searches using a cross-search strategy:

  • Find minimum cells: Where power >= min_power_threshold using max_reads_per_cell (best-case)

  • Find maximum cells: Where power >= max_power_threshold using min_reads_per_cell (worst-case)

This cross-search strategy ensures min_cells <= max_cells and provides robust experimental design ranges from minimally acceptable to well-powered studies.

On this page
